content: unique crochet & knitting designs by theresa knapp ©2016 please do not reproduce change share or sell images or patterns for questions or concerns please email theresa at theresaknapp07@hotmail com little miss allison s dress notes sizes 0-6 months & 12 months recommended yarn bernat cotton-ish photographed dress made with cotton field green lemon twill yellow cotton ball cream turquoise terry turquoise i recommend a #3 weight cotton or cotton blend yarn mercerized cotton works very well too i highly recommend bernat cotton-ish premier yarn cotton fair patton s grace or deborah norville s serenity garden remember yarn quality determines the look of your project recommended hook size 3 5mm e/4 hook gauge 3 5mm e/4 hook 10 single_crochet across x 12 row = 2 x 2 approx 5cm x 5cm square finished size chest 9 months 17 5 approx 45 75 cm 12 months 18 approx 48 25 cm stitches used chain chain single_crochet single_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet double_crochet slip_stitch ____________________________________________________________________________________________ page 1 of 12 unique crochet & knitting designs by theresa knapp ©2016 please do not reproduce change share or sell images or patterns special stitches used see instructions below cross over long double_crochet stitch 3 double_crochet cluster stitch v stitch 4 double_crochet shell 5 double_crochet shell cross over long double_crochet working double_crochet as usual skip 1 stitch work 1 double_crochet in next three stitches now work 1 double_crochet back into skipped stitch yo insert hook into skipped stitch pull up loop do not make the cross over yarn too tight you want the cross over stitch to be fairly loose and lay flat and not be bunched up so pull it even with the 3rd stitch in the group yo pull yarn through 2 loops yo and pull yarn through remaining 2 loops 3 double_crochet cluster stitch in this pattern called just cluster stitch yo insert hook into next stitch and pull up a loop 3 loops on hook yo pull through last 2 loops on hook yo pull up a loop from same stitch 4 loops on hook yo pull through last 2 loops on hook 3 loops remain yo pull up a loop from same stitch 5 loops on hook yo pull through last 2 loops on hook yo pull through remaining 4 loops on hook v stitch 1 double_crochet chain 2 1 double_crochet in same stitch 4 double_crochet shell 2 double_crochet chain 1 2 double_crochet in same stitch 6 double_crochet shell 3 double_crochet chain 1 3 double_crochet in same stitch bodice begin by working in row turning work after each row work in the top loop of the chain only this will leave a braided look to the bottom of the chain which will be the collar of the dress there is a front side and back side to the bodice the front side of the bodice is the right side of row 1 the braid from the chain is clearly visible with this side facing out when you fold the bodice in half
